Already been stated a half dozen times in the thread... 1: it means static objects in the scene can be (re)placed (easier kerbtown stuff) and closer to real time

2: Upgradeable buildings and buying completely new buildings, possibly placed where you want them.

3: Bigger career mods

4: 1 step closer to craters around the bodies of the world.

5: demonstrates the new splosions (this is a different reason than "its funny", therefore it counts)

Isn't that all speculation more than stated feature development?

It "may" lead to some of those things but it might lead to something entirely different.

Oh one general question....

Was KSP built on an ammunition dump?

It would be the Kerbal way.

I mean all the building explode like the fuel is below them when it seems they are hit from above.

If i could just add my two cents here I feel like there are two camps of people, those who want new features and those who want the game polished (and find new features in mods). In my honest opinion destructible buildings seem like the kind of thing that should satisfy both parties. Its both a new feature and polishes the game. Lets face it buildings that can sustain the damage rockets falling on them (which I have done more than once) aren't realistic, so this is pollish in that regard, and its a new feature where can "accidentally" blow up KSC. Yay fun for everyone, now you have a realistic incentive to not drop stages low and the ability to have fun with explosions. Coupled with the fact that Squad explicitly stated that this was going to be a small feature I'm not really sure what everyone is complaining about. Are there things I wanted more then destructible building? Yes (space stations) but I'm not Squad and Squad has a plan (or at least an outline) so I trust that they know what they are doing.

Give me a reason, other than 'it's funny a couple times', why this feature is useful.
Because the feature hints at the possibilities of the underlying system, allowing changes to building at KSC (and perhaps elsewhere).

That may well be, but remains to be seen. For now, it's destructible buildings. Factor in the new cargo/bomb bays, and I presume this will go down as the "bomber patch". It may be the coolest feature they have for this update; improved navball and more spaceplane parts, nevermind their utility, just don't have much hype potential.

I think SQUAD mismanaged the hype machine this time. When maxmaps came around to state (repeatedly?) that really, it's just a small & silly thing -- well, that came too late to deflate the sky-high expectations. But then again, I wonder if the hype machine must be cranked up to full for every update. Sometimes it just is less conspicuous, under-the-hood stuff, and that's just as well.

(navball and SP+ aren't exactly under the hood, but for hype purposes they could as well be).

I don't understand one thing... Devs said that they wouldn't want to tell us what is secret feature... so maybe we have something more. I still have hope for better aero and stock fairings

As for destructable buildings I guess it can be used in multiplayer to improve performance... we should be able to choose do we want to load other people crafts to physics engine or not and even if we won't load them (or those players won't give us permissions to do that ) we still can crash with them and both crafts are getting destroyed.
I wonder, new navball will fully replace "Enhanced Navball" mod?

I am disappointed. If I want to blow a building up, I'll launch Battlefield. KSP is a game where you spend most of the time constructing and launching rockets so I personally think physical model, aerodynamics, avionics, life support, interface (separate thrust control for shuttles? Nah, haven't heard about it) are the components that need to be improved in the first place. But it looks like developers have changed the conception and are now developing FlatOut in Space. Yes, I know that it is just the ground work blah-blah, but the developers still had to create 3D-models for the destroyed buildings! That requires time that could be spent on improving more important components of the game.

Also, I've been playing KSP since 0.8.x, .24 was the first update I skipped and it looks like I'll skip .25 for the same reason - it doesn't offer anything new in the sandbox mode. I think this is the second mistake made by the developers - not everyone plays career mode, and a lack of new features in sandbox makes people bored.
